projectPurpose: To provide a graphical user interface (GUI) Git client that simplifies and enhances the developer's workflow, particularly around managing multiple tasks and branches concurrently, and making complex Git operations more intuitive, aiming to offer a new way of thinking about managing code.
mainFeatures: Virtual Branches (working on multiple branches/tasks simultaneously)
Easy Commit Management (Undo, Amend, Squash via drag-and-drop)

alternatives.name: GitKraken Desktop
alternatives.license: Proprietary (Free for non-commercial/public repos, paid for commercial)

alternatives.name: SmartGit
alternatives.license: Proprietary (Free for non-commercial, paid for commercial)

marketPositioning: GitButler positions itself as a next-generation Git client that goes beyond traditional GUIs by fundamentally changing the workflow, focusing on managing multiple tasks concurrently using "Virtual Branches" and providing a robust "Undo Timeline". It aims to simplify complex Git operations and reduce context switching, appealing to developers who find traditional Git workflows cumbersome. Its inclusion of AI features further positions it as a modern, intelligent tool for source code management.
